alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:39PM EDT until May 06 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Morris, Passaic, and Essex Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Passaic River At Pine Brook. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, street flooding occurs in Fairfield including Camp Lane Road. Two Bridges Road is closed going into Lincoln Park and Wayne. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EDT Friday the stage was 19.21 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM EDT Friday was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage on Saturday morning and continue falling to 17.9 feet on Monday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Passaic River Pine Brook 19.0 19.2 Fri 8 pm 18.8 18.4 Crested &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning.
